intro: Dicrastylis cordifolia var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple heart sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, purple or pink flowers in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or swampy areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. This variety is distinguished by its vibrant purple floral coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties of Dicrastylis.
